  • Field Details

    • lev

      protected Integer lev
      Represents a level or stage indicator, typically used to signify a specific level of operation, configuration, or state within the application. The default value is -1, which may represent an uninitialized or undefined state.

    • PlayersNotSurrended

      protected ArrayList<String> PlayersNotSurrended
      A list containing the names of players who have not surrendered in the game. This variable is protected, allowing access within the same package or subclasses.

    • ShipBoards

      protected ArrayList<ShipBoard> ShipBoards
      A protected list that stores instances of ShipBoard. This list is used to manage and organize multiple ShipBoard objects, which may represent different boards or configurations in a game or application involving ships.

    • flightBoard

      protected FlightBoard flightBoard
      Represents the flight board which may contain information about flights, schedules, or related details. This variable is initialized to null by default and should be assigned appropriately before usage.

    • HiddenTiles

      protected ArrayList<SpaceShipTile> HiddenTiles
      Represents a collection of spaceship tiles that are hidden and not immediately visible within the game. This list is used to manage and store `SpaceShipTile` objects which can later be revealed or accessed when necessary during gameplay or specific events.

    • VisibleTiles

      protected ArrayList<SpaceShipTile> VisibleTiles
      A collection of SpaceShipTile objects that are currently visible. This list is used to store the tiles that are within the viewer's line of sight or field of view, typically for rendering or interaction purposes. The visibility of tiles may be dynamically updated based on various conditions such as user movement, camera position, or game environment changes.

    • TilesInHand

      protected ArrayList<SpaceShipTile> TilesInHand
      Represents the collection of SpaceShipTile objects currently held in hand. It is designed to manage and store the tiles available to a player or object during gameplay implementation. The variable is protected, allowing access within its own package and by subclasses.

    • activatedcard

      protected Card activatedcard
      Represents the card currently activated in the system. This variable holds a reference to the activated card, which may be null if no card is currently active.

    • ThingInHand

      protected Object ThingInHand
      Represents the object currently being held or interacted with. The value of this field can be any object and is initialized to null by default. It can be used to track the state or possession of an item within the context of an application. This field is protected, meaning it can be accessed within the class itself, by subclasses, and by other classes in the same package.

    • bank

      protected Bank bank
      Represents a bank entity within the context of the application. This variable can be used to store and access information or methods related to the bank.

    • timetofill

      protected boolean timetofill
      Represents a flag indicating whether it is time to fill. This variable is used to determine if a specific action or process related to filling needs to occur.

    • cansurrend

      protected Boolean cansurrend
      Indicates whether the entity or object has the ability to surrender. It represents a state that can either be true or false.

    • gameState

      protected stateEnum gameState
      Represents the current state of the game. This variable holds a value of the stateEnum type which encapsulates the various states the game can be in (e.g., START, PAUSE, RUNNING, GAME_OVER). It is used to manage and control the game's flow and state transitions.

    • cardState

      protected stateEnum cardState
      Represents the current state of a card within a system. The possible values are defined in the stateEnum enumeration. This variable is used to track and manage the lifecycle or status of a card, such as active, inactive, or pending states.

    • finalScores

      protected HashMap<String,Float> finalScores
      A protected HashMap that stores the final scores for specific items identified by their names. The keys in the map are Strings representing the names, and the values are Floats representing the corresponding scores.

    • message

      protected String message
      A protected string variable to hold a message. The purpose or usage of this variable can vary depending on the context of the application.

    • generalView

      protected GeneralView generalView
      Represents a general view component, typically used for displaying or handling common UI elements or interactions within the application. This variable may be used to manage or render a shared visual representation across different modules or components. Accessibility is protected to ensure that it is only available within the class itself, its subclasses, or other classes within the same package.

    • timeRemaining

      protected volatile int timeRemaining
      Represents the remaining time, typically utilized to track or manage a countdown or duration in a specific process or task. This variable is declared as volatile to ensure visibility of updates across multiple threads in a concurrent environment. Being protected, it is accessible within its own package and by subclasses. The time is stored as an integer, where its meaning and unit (e.g., seconds, milliseconds) depend on the context in which it is used.

    • myNickname

      protected String myNickname
      Represents a user's nickname or short identifier. This variable is intended to store a shortened or alternative name that a user might prefer to be addressed by. It can be used for personalization or display purposes.

    • dice

      protected int dice
      Represents the result of a dice roll. The variable holds the value of the dice, which is typically in the range of standard dice rolls (e.g., 1-6). The default value is -1, indicating that no dice roll has occurred or the dice is uninitialized.

    • updateGameCreated

      public void updateGameCreated(int level, List<Deck> showableDecks, List<Player> players, int hourglassResting, int surrenderResting) throws Exception
      Updates the game configuration when a new game is created, initializing game state, players, and ships.
      Parameters:
      level - the level of the game, where 1 represents a specific mode, 0 represents test mode, and other values throw an IllegalArgumentException as unsupported levels.
      showableDecks - a list of decks that are visible or available to the players during the game.
      players - a list of players participating in the game.
      hourglassResting - the remaining number of hourglass time markers for the game.
      surrenderResting - the remaining number of surrender markers for the game.
      Throws:
      Exception - if there is an error during game initialization, including invalid configurations.

      public void insertTileLMR(int TileIndex, int r, int c, int rotation, String playerNickname) throws Exception
      Inserts a tile into the specified coordinates on a player's ship board, rotates the tile as necessary, and updates the appropriate states for the tile and player.
      Parameters:
      TileIndex - The unique identifier of the tile to be inserted from the player's hand.
      r - The row position on the ship board where the tile will be inserted.
      c - The column position on the ship board where the tile will be inserted.
      rotation - The number of 90-degree right rotations to apply to the tile before insertion.
      playerNickname - The nickname of the player whose ship board will receive the tile.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the insertion or rotation process.

    • AutomaticFillTile

      public void AutomaticFillTile() throws Exception
      Automatically fills tiles on shipboards with necessary components such as battery units and lonely passengers through predefined methods. This method iterates through a collection of shipboards and ensures that each shipboard has its tiles populated with the following: - Battery units by invoking the addBatteryUnitLMR(ShipBoard) method. - Lonely passengers by invoking the addLonelyPassengers(ShipBoard) method.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs while processing shipboards or executing the filling methods on tiles.

      Parameters:
      playerNickname - the nickname of the player whose ship board is being modified
      wantAlien - a boolean indicating whether to add an alien (true) or humans (false)
      alienColor - the color of the alien to be added, if adding an alien
      row - the row index of the target tile on the player's ship board
      column - the column index of the target tile on the player's ship board
      Throws:
      Exception - if any unexpected error occurs during the execution

      Finalizes the building phase for a specific player and updates the game state accordingly.

      positionwheretogo - the position the player intends to move to after ending the building phase
      Throws:

    • completeBuildingPhase

      public void completeBuildingPhase() throws Exception
      Completes the building phase for all ship boards in the game. This method iterates through all ship boards associated with their respective players, performs a check for empty or invalid tiles in the ship matrix, and assigns default tiles where necessary. The default tiles are created with a smooth-side connector and marked as non-accessible places. If a tile is not yet associated with an attached ship, it sets the associated ship to the current ship board. Additionally, the player associated with each ship board is unblocked, allowing further actions or progress in the game. Lastly, calls the `AutomaticFillTile` method to perform any additional automated tile-filling tasks.
      Throws:
      Exception - if there is an issue during the completion of the building phase.

    • endBuildingPhaseForAll

      public void endBuildingPhaseForAll() throws Exception
      Ends the building phase for all players by marking them as blocked if they are not included in the flight board ranking. This method iterates through all ShipBoard instances in the collection and checks if the player associated with each ShipBoard is present in the ranking list retrieved from the flightBoard. If a player's ShipBoard is not found in the ranking, the player is marked as blocked by setting their 'blocked' status to true.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during execution

    • chooseToClaimRewardSmug

      Allows the specified player to choose whether to claim a reward. If the player accepts the reward, it processes the reward by validating the storage tiles and new goods, applying any associated penalties, adding goods to the player's storage, and updating the flight board and game view accordingly. If the player refuses the reward, no changes are made.
      Parameters:

      player - The player who is deciding whether to claim the reward.

      newgoods - A list of new goods to be added to storage if the reward is claimed.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the reward claiming process.

      PLAYER - the player who is initiating the process
      flightBoard - the current flight board in play
      enginesPos - a list of positions specifying the engines chosen by the player
      batteriesPos - a list of positions specifying the batteries chosen by the player
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the process

    • meteorCardChooseHowToFaceMeteors

      public void meteorCardChooseHowToFaceMeteors(Player player, ArrayList<Integer> howToDefenceFromShots, ArrayList<Shot> shots, int dice, int currentShot) throws Exception
      Handles the player's choice on how to deal with incoming meteors in a game scenario. This method validates the given defense strategy and applies the defense mechanism for the meteor shots. Additionally, it updates the game view based on whether a valid defense strategy is applied or not.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is responding to the meteor scenario.
      howToDefenceFromShots - A list of integers representing the chosen defensive strategy for the current meteor shots.
      shots - A list of shots, each representing an incoming meteor that needs to be addressed.
      dice - The result of a dice roll to potentially influence the meteor encounter.
      currentShot - The index of the current shot being processed from the list of meteor shots.
      Throws:
      Exception - If any error occurs during the processing of the meteor defense logic.

    • epidemicStateBaseActivate

      public void epidemicStateBaseActivate(Set<SpaceShipTile> AlreadyVisited) throws Exception
      Activates the epidemic state for a set of specified spaceship tiles. This method processes the ships of all active players (who are not blocked). It identifies cabin tiles with adjacent cabins that either have passengers or aliens present and adds them to the AlreadyVisited set. Subsequently, actions are triggered to reduce the number of passengers or remove aliens from the affected tiles.
      Parameters:
      AlreadyVisited - a set of SpaceShipTile objects that tracks the tiles already visited and processed during the activation of the epidemic state
      Throws:
      Exception - if any unexpected issue arises during the processing or manipulation of spaceship tiles, such as removing entities or updating views

    • stardustEffect

      public void stardustEffect() throws Exception
      Applies the "stardust effect" to all players on the flight board. This method retrieves the current ranking of players, reverses the order, and processes each player based on the number of their ship's exposed connectors. Each player is moved backward on the flight board by the number of exposed connectors. The visual representation of the player's position is updated accordingly.
      Throws:
      Exception - if there is an error during any of the operations performed.

      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs while showing the message.

    • stopBuilding

      public void stopBuilding() throws Exception
      Stops the building phase of the game. This method marks the termination of the building phase by updating the message and manipulating certain properties of ship objects within the game. Specifically, it processes all ShipBoard objects, and if a ShipBoard instance is of type ShipBoard_LevelII, it removes waiting tiles associated with the end of building. Additionally, it updates the general view to remove specific tiles and display an information message to all players.
      Throws:
      Exception - if any operation within the method encounters a failure.

    • timerStarted

      public void timerStarted() throws Exception
      Initiates a countdown timer and displays its status. The method sets the initial message, updates the remaining time value, and begins a separate thread to handle the countdown process. The countdown continues, decrementing the remaining time once per second, until the time runs out or the thread is interrupted.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs while processing the countdown or updating the UI.

    • ChooseSubship

      public void ChooseSubship(String playerNickname, ArrayList<ArrayList<SpaceShipTile>> subShips, int indexToPreserve, int waste) throws Exception

    • removeSingleTile

      public void removeSingleTile(String playerNickname, int row, int col, boolean fromMistake, int waste) throws Exception
      Removes a single tile from the player's ship board matrix at the specified location. If the tile is removed from a test flight board and is not due to a mistake, it increments the waste count. The method updates the ship matrix and handles the removal accordingly.
      Parameters:
      playerNickname - the nickname of the player whose tile will be removed
      row - the row index of the tile to be removed
      col - the column index of the tile to be removed
      fromMistake - whether the removal is due to a mistake
      waste - the current count of waste pieces, which may be incremented by this action
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the tile removal process

    • addTileToWaitList

      public void addTileToWaitList(String playerNickname, int tileIndex) throws Exception
      Adds a tile currently held by a player to the wait list on their respective ship board. If the player has a tile in hand and a wait list slot is available, the tile is placed in the first available slot, either WaitTile1 or WaitTile2 on the ship board.
      Parameters:
      playerNickname - the nickname of the player whose tile should be added to the wait list
      tileIndex - the index of the tile to be added to the wait list
      Throws:
      Exception - if the operation fails due to any error in retrieving or updating the player's tile or wait list

    • insertWaitTileLMR

      public void insertWaitTileLMR(String playerNickname, int index) throws Exception
      Inserts a wait tile into the player's hand based on the specified index. The wait tile is fetched from the player's ship board if available, and the corresponding position on the ship board is set to null. Updates the general view according to the index and player's nickname.
      Parameters:
      playerNickname - the nickname of the player whose ship board is being accessed
      index - the index of the wait tile to be inserted (0 or 1)
      Throws:
      Exception - if there is an issue processing the operation

    • manageShotReceivedLMR

      public void manageShotReceivedLMR(Shot shot, ArrayList<Integer> values, int dice, ShipBoard s) throws Exception
      Handles the management of a received shot in the context of a specific ship and its components.
      Parameters:
      shot - The shot object representing the received shot.
      values - A list of integers containing specific indices or values related to the shot, such as coordinates.
      dice - An integer representing the dice roll or related value.
      s - The ship board object containing the structure of the ship's components and state.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the shot management process.

    • removePassengersLMR

      public void removePassengersLMR(int row, int col, int num, ShipBoard s) throws Exception
      Removes a specified number of passengers from a housing unit located at the given row and column on the ship board. If the number of passengers to be removed exceeds the current number of passengers in the housing unit, the number of passengers is set to zero, and further adjustments are handled via the general view system.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index of the housing unit on the ship board
      col - the column index of the housing unit on the ship board
      num - the number of passengers to remove from the housing unit
      s - the ship board object containing the matrix of tiles and other relevant data
      Throws:
      Exception - if any issue arises during the removal process

    • removeAlienLMR

      public void removeAlienLMR(Tile_HousingUnit tile, ShipBoard s) throws Exception
      Removes an alien from the specified tile on the ship board of the player owning the tile. If the alien is present on the given tile, it is removed and the alien-related data is cleared.
      Parameters:
      tile - The Tile_HousingUnit object representing the tile where the alien is to be removed.
      s - The ShipBoard object of the ship associated with the player performing the action.
      Throws:
      Exception - If any error occurs during the process of removing the alien.

    • lostBatteries

      public void lostBatteries(Player p, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> batteriesToAct) throws Exception
      Processes the removal of charges from specified battery positions on the player's shipboard and updates the general view accordingly.
      Parameters:
      p - The player for whom the battery charges are being removed.
      batteriesToAct - A list of battery positions and the respective amounts of charge to remove. Each entry contains a list where the first element is the x-coordinate, the second element is the y-coordinate, and the third element is the amount of charge to remove.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the processing of the battery charge removal.
